profile.name: Rik Wanders
profile.title: Senior Full-Stack Developer
profile.subtitle: Building scalable web applications for remote teams
profile.headline: Full-Stack Developer 10+ years expertise in Python, Django, Node.js, React, CI/CD, DevOps, UX, AI
profile.summary: Dutch Senior Full-Stack Developer residing in Spain. 10+ years Python & Node.js experience, scaling complex, high-traffic & data heavy applications with Django & React, and leading development teams. Additional skills in DevOps, CI/CD & UXD. Current with industry trends, AI & security. Thrives in agile teams / startup environments. 5+ years remote work experience.

highlights.text: Expertise in modern Python, JavaScript & Node.js ecosystems
Team leadership and project management experience
Skilled in developing scalable solutions for high-traffic applications
5+ years remote work and distributed team collaboration experience
AI-accelerated development skills with security best practices

work_experiences.name: Chipta
work_experiences.summary: Led teams of 3-5 developers at innovative ticketing platform for over 7 years, scaling the platform from concept to processing thousands of orders per minute. Optimized platform performance by 30-60%, implemented comprehensive testing suites, and orchestrated CI/CD systems. Built React Native mobile apps that contributed to a 40% revenue increase, modernized frontend interfaces with React, increasing user engagement by 30%. And integrated critical payment systems processing tens of millions in transactions.

achievements.title: Team Leadership
achievements.description: Led distributed development team (3-5 devs) with agile methods and strict code review processes, optimizing output 25%

achievements.title: Platform Scalability
achievements.description: Enabled processing thousands of orders per minute, by optimizating SQL & Python/Django process up to 60% & caching

achievements.title: Frontend Modernization
achievements.description: Increased user engagement by +30%, by modernizing frontend UX using React, responsive design & web components

achievements.title: Mobile App Development
achievements.description: Contributed to scalability & 40% revenue growth by leading ticket scan app development with React Native & WebSockets

achievements.title: Test Driven Development
achievements.description: Decreased regression with 90%, by establishing TDD with quality testing suite using Django & Selenium (+80% coverage)

achievements.title: CI/CD Systems
achievements.description: Reduced deploy time -80% & enabled regular releases, by orchestrating CI/CD systems on Linode using Ansible & Python

achievements.title: Docker Compose Setup

achievements.title: REST API implementations

achievements.title: Internationalization

work_experiences.name: Tender-it
work_experiences.summary: Built comprehensive tender discovery platform from scratch as Lead Developer, designing complete platform using agile methodology in consultation with non-technical founders. Developed industry-first Elasticsearch-powered search engine filtering hundreds of thousands of tenders, engineered automated web crawling systems importing thousands of tenders daily, and implemented subscription-based revenue model with recurring payments and automated notification systems.

achievements.title: Product Development
achievements.description: Delivered complete platform with Python, Django & React in consultation with non-technical founders

achievements.title: Data Automation
achievements.description: Transformed thousands of tenders daily into structured data, by making web crawlers & importers with Django & Celery

achievements.title: Search Innovation

side_projects.name: Portfolio website
side_projects.summary: Personal portfolio website showcasing my professional experience, skills, and services as a freelance/independent developer. Including personal dashboard with AI features for efficient job matching. Using Svelte & Directus CMS.

side_projects.name: LitState
side_projects.summary: Reactive state management library for Lit Web Components, Open-sourced on GitHub & NPM. Used in production at Chipta (ticket shop). Lit + LitState is a simpler, lightweight and browser-native alternative to React + Redux.

side_projects.name: Django Admin Relation Links
side_projects.summary: Django Admin navigation enhancement, simplifying navigation between related database objects. Open-sourced on GitHub and PyPi. Used in production at Chipta & Tender-it.

side_projects.name: Git Submodules Guide
side_projects.summary: Popular GitHub Gist explaining Git submodules fundamentals. Helped many developers understand submodules effectively.

side_projects.name: Jazzchords

side_projects.name: Adyengo
side_projects.summary: Open-source Django package for Adyen payment integration with recurring payment support. Used in production at Tender-it.

side_projects.name: Monkful
side_projects.summary: Python package to easily create RESTful API's for MongoEngine documents used for MongoDB database. Inspired by Django REST framework. Used in production at Travelbird.

education.summary: Comprehensive 4-year program including foundational computer science, algorithms, and data structures.
I liked many aspects of the field (music & tech), but ultimately decided that it wasn't something I wanted to pursue in.
Educated in topics like maths, physics, chemistry, biology, geography, economy, history, social studies, Dutch & English.
Educated in core subjects like Dutch, maths, science, history, geography, gym & creative activities (art, music).

references.author: Elmar Krack
references.text: Rik demonstrated exceptional technical leadership by designing and developing our entire platform from the ground up, handling both backend and frontend development with impressive skill.

references.author: Michaël de Groot
references.text: Rik modernized our client-facing interfaces and implemented backend optimizations that delivered substantial performance improvements. His work enabled us to process thousands of tickets rapidly during our busiest periods.

project_stories.title: Ticketshop performance scaling for big events
project_stories.situation:
- Big event clients selling thousands of tickets
- Ticketshop having hard times handling large traffic spikes
- Performance bottlenecks in processing the orders
- Clients needed reliable ticketshop to sell their tickets fast
project_stories.task:
- Speed up ticketshop order processing
- Handle high-traffic ticketshop spikes
- Work with DevOps (Michaël) on scaling
project_stories.action:
- Optimized SQL queries - got 30-60% speed boost
- Refactored Python/Django order processing code
- Worked with DevOps (Michaël) on flexible scaling setup
project_stories.result:
- Big event clients successfully kept/onboarded
- 30-60% faster ticket order processing
- Scalable ticketshop ready for large events
project_stories.reflection:
- I didn't realize how many queries were being done before optimizing
- Optimizing complex SQL queries in Django can be challenging
- But tools like Silk make debugging very user friendly

project_stories.title: LitState - State management library for Lit
project_stories.situation:
- I used the library "Lit" as a lightweight React replacement
- Very satisfied about it, but lacked state management library
- State management between multiple components cumbersome
project_stories.task:
- Wanted to create a dedicated state management library for Lit
- Wanted to keep it simple but elegant and easy to use
- Wanted to be able to re-use it in any project using Lit
project_stories.action:
- Created LitState, a state management library for Lit
- Open-sourced & distributed as an NPM package
- Created complete and clear documentation
project_stories.result:
- Does exactly what I need
- Tiny source code, but very intuitive
- Works very efficiently
- Used successfully in production at Chipta
- Got GitHub user engagement, PRs and issues
- Maintained package
project_stories.reflection:
- Was very much fun creating an open-source NPM package
- I'm still happy about the result
- It's sad Lit hasn't gained more popularity
- I still think it's good modern technology for today:
  - Lit is still much faster than React
  - LitState is still a very efficient and useful state management library

project_stories.title: Zoom OAuth integration during COVID
project_stories.situation:
- COVID hit and clients needed virtual events
- No Zoom integration in our platform
- Event organizers needed seamless online solution
project_stories.task:
- Learn Zoom API and OAuth quickly
- Integrate client accounts with dashboard
- Enable automatic Zoom management for Chipta events
project_stories.action:
- Mastered Zoom OAuth and API documentation
- Navigated strict app admittance process
- Built dashboard integration for client accounts
- Created automatic Zoom event management system
project_stories.result:
- Many clients successfully organized online events
- Helped company survive COVID with less than 40% profit loss
- Seamless Chipta-Zoom integration in production
project_stories.reflection:
- Zoom Marketplace submission requirements were much more than I expected
- After COVID was over, the online event hype disappeared again
- COVID was a hard time to be strategical
- Clients do appreciate quick acting and temporary solutions

project_stories.title: Smart Job Seeker - AI-driven job-matching system
project_stories.situation:
- Finding appropriate vacancies takes a lot of time
- It's repetitive work
- Adjusting resume/CV for every application takes time
- Writing custom cover letter takes time
- Answering common interview questions takes time
- Tracking all running applications takes time
project_stories.task:
- Make the process easier, automate repetitive tasks
- Use AI to find appropriate job matches
- Make a easily customizable resume/CV generation system
- Use AI to help write custom cover letters
- Save re-usable common interview questions
- Have all running applications in overview
project_stories.action:
- Created personal platform for job hunting
- Used AI tools to match my profile with jobs with OpenAI & Gemini APIs
- Created custom resume/CV generation system with Svelte + Directus CMS
- Created module to help generate cover letter with AI
- Created database for common interview / application questions
- Created overview for tracking application status
project_stories.result:
- Faster results of suitable vacancies
- Better customization for each application
- More confident when applying
- Process becomes more fun and streamlined
- Learning new skills I can use on my resume/CV
project_stories.reflection:
- Happy to have started it
- Plans to eventually open source it
- Useful for the rest of my career

project_stories.title: Introduced agile / async team workflow @ Chipta
project_stories.situation:
- Early days at Chipta with minimal team structure
- 3-5 developers working without established methodologies
- Changing requirements from management causing confusion with devs
- Need to scale development processes as team grew
project_stories.task:
- Introduce structured development methodologies
- Get all team members aligned on new processes
- Implement tools and workflows for better collaboration
- Improve team efficiency and productivity
project_stories.action:
- Progressively introduced Scrum/Agile methodologies with team buy-in
- Implemented Zulip for structured async collaboration
- Established GitLab Merge Request workflow with code reviews
- Introduced Git flow and commit message conventions
- Set up and managed comprehensive issue ticket system
project_stories.result:
- Successfully transitioned team to structured development process
- Improved team coordination and reduced miscommunication
- Increased development efficiency and code quality
- Created scalable processes that supported team growth over 7 years
project_stories.reflection:
- An efficient team workflow makes a big difference
- There are many ways to do Agile and every team is unique

project_stories.title: TicketSwap integration deadline for major client
project_stories.situation:
- Major event organizer prospect required TicketSwap integration
- Hard deadline of 3 weeks to deliver or lose the prospect
- Complex coordination needed with external development team
project_stories.task:
- Build secure TicketSwap API integration for second-hand ticket validation
- Coordinate with TicketSwap developers on protocols and implementation steps
- Deliver working solution within 3-week deadline to close the deal
project_stories.action:
- Contacted TicketSwap's technical team to establish communication protocols
- Coordinated step-by-step implementation process with their developers
- Built secure integration with comprehensive testing suite
- Managed coordination between TicketSwap team, prospect, and internal stakeholders
project_stories.result:
- Delivered integration on time and secured the client
- Eliminated ticket fraud for integrated events
- Became competitive advantage leading to 15% increase in sales
project_stories.reflection:
- Things can be done very fast when all parties have interests
- Direct communication between devs of two companies is very efficient

project_stories.title: Automated integration testing with Selenium
project_stories.situation:
- Manual integration testing required before each production deployment
- Testing process took up to 1.5 hours per release
- Process was error prone because of human errors
- Time-consuming manual process slowed down development cycle
project_stories.task:
- Eliminate manual testing bottleneck
- Enable faster, more reliable deployments
- Reduce time investment required for each release
- Improve reliability of test results
project_stories.action:
- Researched automated testing solutions and selected Selenium
- Built comprehensive Selenium test suite covering the existing manual test procedures
- Integrated automated tests into deployment pipeline
- Created documentation for developers on running tests and creating new ones
project_stories.result:
- Reduced integration testing time from 1.5 hours to 5 minutes
- Enabled any developer to run complete integration test suite
- Increased deployment frequency and confidence
- Eliminated testing bottleneck and improved development velocity
project_stories.reflection:
- Learned Selenium is pretty cool and not that hard
- Learned that creating integration tests is totally worth it if you need to test for every release
- Now that I know Selenium, would apply it faster to save time earlier

project_stories.title: Onboarding junior developer to Django system
project_stories.situation:
- New junior developer joined comprehensive Django project
- Developer needed to learn Django framework
- Complex system with frontend integration
- Multiple new skills needed simultaneously
project_stories.task:
- Guide developer through system architecture
- Teach Django best practices
- Train on frontend technologies
- Make developer productive on assigned projects
project_stories.action:
- Created structured learning plan covering Django and frontend
- Paired programming sessions to demonstrate system
- Regular code reviews with detailed explanations
- Gradually increased project complexity and responsibility
project_stories.result:
- Developer became productive within first month
- Successfully delivered assigned project features
- Developer gained confidence in both Django and frontend
- Created reusable onboarding process for future hires
project_stories.reflection:
- Learned I need to ask more feedback from developers to understand what they actually need
- Junior developer could be stuck without me knowing it
- Check in to developers progress and have evaluation sessions

- It's useful when developer creates own docs / notes
- There are always things to improve about the onboarding process
- It's a fun process helping a developer getting up and running

project_stories.title: React Native App Technical Challenges
project_stories.situation:
- Leading React Native mobile app development at Chipta
- React Native framework had significant bugs and limitations
- Limited documentation and community support available
- Tight deadline before festival season start
project_stories.task:
- Navigate technical challenges with immature framework
- Find solutions to framework bugs and limitations
- Deliver functional app on schedule
- Ensure app met performance and reliability requirements
project_stories.action:
- Helped developer to tackle complex technical issues
- Researched React Native & plugins source code to understand underlying problems
- Created custom patches for framework bugs we encountered
- Made architecture decisions to work around limitations
project_stories.result:
- Delivered app on time before festival season started
- App significantly improved event scalability and reach
- Contributed to 40% revenue increase from mobile ticket sales
- Developer gained valuable React Native expertise
- Established foundation for future mobile development projects
project_stories.reflection:
- Learned that new hip projects from major companies are not necessarily stable or well documented from the start
- Was ultimately happy with choosing React Native
- Because it matured and is still one of the main ways of creating apps

application_questions.question:
Tell us about your experience building a project with a Python backend.

- What kind of project was it?
- What technologies and frameworks did you use (e.g., Flask, FastAPI, Django, etc.)?
- (Optional) Please share a link (GitHub repo, live demo, or case study) if available.
application_questions.answer:
At Chipta I've build the Django backend from the ground up. I attached Django to an existing database, enabling a smooth transition from the previous system. I even modified Django to work with an existing translation system.

I added React to the project for dynamic frontend pages, and used Django REST Framework to create APIs accommodating the React frontend. Many APIs were for admin pages so needed authentication and permission checks. I also implemented pagination, nested routing (using drf-nested-routers), filtering (using django-filter), field-based filtering (using drf-flex-fields), and custom APIs with custom urls.

Chipta is a ticketing system for event organizers. They can use the system to create a ticket shop and sell their tickets online. I've scaled the system to be able to handle thousands of ticket orders per minute. To optimize the SQL queries and Python processes, I used tools like Django Silk and Django Debug Toolbar.

Chipta has processed millions of euros in transactions. I developed the ticketshop, API and server processes that handle these transactions. I used payment provider SDKs to create the payments and forward users to the payment page.

To mail the tickets to users, I used Django's EmailMultiAlternatives class to send pretty HTML emails including inline images, not requiring loading external resources.

To create ticket PDFs, I used Django-WeasyPrint, which uses Weasyprint under the hood, and transforms a Django HTML template, including styles and images, to a PDF file.

I used Python Fabric to build a comprehensive custom CI/CD pipeline to deploy the project to our servers.

I used Selenium to write integration tests to automatically test our frontend.

You can sign up and create a ticketshop yourself at: https://chipta.com/
application_questions.title: Python backend building experience

application_questions.question:
Have you built or worked on systems that manage a lot of structured information or documents (e.g., internal platforms, CRMs, audit systems, or similar)? *

- Describe what the system did and how you contributed.
- What kind of data or documents were handled?
- How did you design the backend (APIs, database, integrations, etc.)?
- (Optional) Did you add any AI-powered or automation features using Python?
application_questions.answer:
At Tender-it, I created a Django + Celery project that ran web crawlers that scraped tender data from various sources in various formats, then parsed that data into one format and saved it to the database. A A tender is a formal competitive bidding process for contracts, usually big government projects. The scripts would import thousands of tenders each day. Then I created a web platform with an Elasticsearch-based search engine to search, filter, sort and score these tenders.

Some sources offered a REST API with JSON or structured data in some way. In those cases it was easy to get the data parse it. But many sources had out-of-date technology, and I needed to use unconventional methods to get the data, like website scraping, API reverse engineering, zip files with XML files over FTP, CSV files over email.

So I created a base class for importing the data and a base class for parsing the data. Then for each source I created a class, inheriting the base class and implementing the required methods. The base classes provided many helper methods for implementing common functionality. Like this I could easily add new sources.

I imported all structured data into the MariaDB database. Then I created records in Elasticsearch with all the data that should be search-able, with a reference to the complete data in the database. In this way I could use Elasticsearch to efficiently find the desired record, and when found, fetch the complete info from the database.
application_questions.title: Data management system experience

application_questions.question: Tell us about a project where you built or shipped a full-stack application. What was your role, and what technologies did you use?
application_questions.answer:
At Chipta, I led a project creating a ticket scanning app, to scan and validate event entrance tickets, using the phone camera. I decided on using React Native, and guided a medior developer to set up the project and make architectural decisions. I focused on providing the REST APIs and the related business logic.

The scan app would often be used by multiple people at the same time. So I had to make sure to keep the scan apps synchronized, so the same ticket could not be used multiple times. I used a websocket connection between the apps and the Django backend, using Django Channels. With an open websocket connection, I could instantly send data from the app to the backend and vice-versa, without any request overhead. This allowed me to create a custom protocol to send various types of data, like ticket scans, or undo-ing a scan, or even adding more valid tickets.

When an app scanned a ticket, it send data about it to the backend over the websocket connection. Then the backend would broadcast this scan data to the other scan apps with open websocket connections, synchronizing the apps. Also, if an administrator would update the status of a visitor's ticket in the backend, it would also be broadcasted over the websockets.

We also created functionality for offline usage. The scan app would locally cache the tickets, and if the internet connection would be temporarily gone, still be able to scan tickets. After connection came back, it would restore synchronization and have custom conflict resolution in case of conflicts.

The scan app was successfully released on the Google Play Store and Apple App Store, under the name "Chipta". Hundreds of event organizers have successfully used it to validate tickets from over a million of visitors at their events. The app was very important for Chipta's growth as it significantly reduced custom scanner hardware costs and management, and  contributed to a 40% revenue increase in the 2 years after the release.

Chipta in the Google Play Store:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.chipta

Chipta in the Apple App Store:
https://apps.apple.com/us/app/chipta/id1156524548
application_questions.title: Full-stack app building experience

cheat_sheets.title: Intro Talk - EN
cheat_sheets.content:
# Interview Introduction Cheat Sheet

## Main

- Dutch Senior Full Stack Developer
- 18+ years of experience
- currently based in Spain
- specialize in Python & Node.js ecosystems
- Strong on both back & frontend

## More

- Lot of experience scaling high-traffic applications
- 5+ years remote work experience
- Experience in both startup and enterprise environments
- Agile methodologies experience

## Chipta

- 10 years Lead Developer @ Chipta
- Managed teams of 3-5 developers
- Built ticketing platform:
  - Served thousands of events
  - Processing thousands of tickets/minute
  - Processed tens of millions in ticket sales
- High-traffic page performance improvements (40-60%)

### Achievements

- Transformed proof-of-concept into competitive ticketing platform
- Serving thousands of events
- Processing high-volume traffic reliably

### Left because

Didn't reach the breakthrough we hoped for.

## Tender-it

- Built complete platform from scratch
- Agile workflow with non-technical founders
- Extensive search engine using Elasticsearch
- Crawling websites, process & import data
- Built subscription system with recurring payments

### Achievements

- Delivered complete product to requirements of founders
- Helping companies find appropriate tenders easily

### Left because

Competitor overtook us.

## TravelBird

- Rapidly growing company
- Part of innovative mobile team
- Objective-C + XCode
- API architect for mobile apps

### Left because

Wasn't satisfied with company reorganization.

## 🔧 Technical Expertise

### Expert

- Python (Django, DRF, Channels, Silk, Celery)
- JavaScript/Node.js (React, MobX, Svelte, Lit, Webcomponents)
- SQL databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite)
- Linux, DevOps, CI/CD
- Vercel, Linode, AWS
- AI-accelerated development (Claude Code, Cursor)

## Work principles

- Agile, Scrum, Kanban
- Security-first mindset
- TDD
- Component-based development
- UX
- Code reviewing
- Documentation

## Concrete Achievements

- Platform scaling
  - Profiling
  - Query optimization
  - Algorithmic optimization
  - Caching
  - Load balancing
  - Auto-scaling servers

- API integrations
  - Connect DB to third-parties
  - OAuth integrations for account sharing

- Payment integrations
  - Mollie
  - Pay.nl
  - Adyen
  - Paypal

- Internationalization
  - Translations
  - Location-aware content
  - Multi-currency support

- Test suite
  - TDD
  - Unit tests
  - Integration tests (with Selenium)

## 👤 Personal Touch (when appropriate)

- Playing guitar since age 12, had a band
- Got into web development by creating website for band
- Travel & nature lover
  - Walked Camino de Santiago
  - Traveled around Mexico & Ecuador

## Current situation

- Renting out house in NL
- Traveled south in camper
- Family/friends across Spain & Portugal
- Currently working from sister's office in southern Spain
  - Plenty of space & dedicated workspace

## What I'm Looking For

- Remote work
- Projects 6-12 months
- Long-term part-time
- Innovative agile (startup) environments

## Recent technologies of interest?

- AI-accelerated development (Claude, Cursor)
- AI / LLM integrations (OpenAI API)
- Svelte & Tailwind
- Machine Learning & Data Science

## Recent projects

- Handy House Manual
- SmartFeed
- Smart Home integrations (ESP32, Raspi)
- Portfolio & CV

---

## Common Follow-up Questions

### Challenging projects?

- Scaling (Chipta)
  - Figuring out what/why slow
  - How to optimize
  - Testing optimizations

- Team leadership (Chipta)
  - Guidance, what someone needs
  - Estimate someone's skills
  - Reviewing code & giving feedback

- Developing complete project (Tender-it)
  - Taking responsibility of full stack
    - Dealing with problems on all layers of stack
  - Scrum planning
  - Coordinating with non-technical founders

- Mobile app development (TravelBird & Chipta)
  - Learning new technologies
  - App/Play store review policies
  - Testing on various devices
  - Web Sockets for Chipta Scan App

### Why remote work?"

- Love traveling & nature
- Efficiency & flexibility
- Stay focussed with Scrum / Agile methodologies
- Collaboration software (Slack, Teams, Zoom)
- 5+ years experience
- I believe in it

cheat_sheets.title: Why I quit Chipta
cheat_sheets.content:
After 10 incredible years at Chipta, I'm proud of what we accomplished - we
built a robust ticketing platform that scaled to handle thousands of tickets per
minute and served thousands of events. I led the technical development from
concept through significant growth, and we created a solid product that competed
well in the market.

However, after a decade of dedication, the company hadn't achieved the market
breakthrough we'd hoped for. While we had technical success and served our
clients well, the business faced ongoing challenges in scaling to the next
level. I realized it was time for me to seek new challenges where I could apply
everything I'd learned in a fresh environment with different growth
opportunities.

Those 10 years taught me invaluable lessons about building scalable systems,
leading teams, and the realities of startup growth. I'm excited to bring that
experience to a new role where I can make an immediate impact.
